function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increase in energy efficiency score may lead to changes in building systems and practices that can affect indoor air quality.","Impact":"Poor indoor air quality can lead to health issues and the spread of contagious diseases within the built environment.","Mitigation":"Regular monitoring of indoor air quality, proper ventilation systems, and use of air purification technologies can help mitigate the impact.","Technologies":"Air quality sensors, HVAC systems with proper filtration, air purifiers.","People":"Building occupants, especially those with existing health conditions.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, and building maintenance staff."},{"Description":"Changes in control of distribution pumps and heat generators for energy efficiency may affect the thermal comfort of building occupants.","Impact":"Uncomfortable indoor temperatures can lead to stress, discomfort, and potential health issues for occupants.","Mitigation":"Balancing energy efficiency with thermal comfort through advanced control systems and feedback from building occupants. Regular temperature monitoring and adjustments.","Technologies":"Smart HVAC systems, occupancy sensors, feedback mechanisms, temperature control algorithms.","People":"Building occupants, facility managers, building maintenance staff.","Owner":"Building owners, energy management teams."},{"Description":"Limiting changes to certain building systems due to constraints may result in uneven distribution of energy efficiency improvements, leading to potential performance and health disparities within the building.","Impact":"Unequal energy efficiency improvements can result in areas of the building being more susceptible to poor indoor air quality and uncomfortable temperatures.","Mitigation":"Implementing strategies to address disparities, such as zoning control, maintenance priority planning, and targeted improvements in constrained areas.","Technologies":"Zoning systems, targeted maintenance tools, performance monitoring sensors.","People":"Building occupants in areas with limited improvements, building maintenance staff in charge of constrained areas.","Owner":"Building owners, facility management teams."}]}
